text: Thank you kraddel & tderoeck! Sampled 330 ml. bottle @ VCBF 2017. 2016 Vintage. Great history lesson / throwback treat. Amber orange, little white head. Nose is sweet oily toffee, low oxidation, orange peel, sugar. Taste is boozy orange peel, toffee marmalade, oily, more monolithic in taste than you would expect, bit boozy with toffee. Body is warming oily toffee, marmalade, oily. Feels like it might benefit a bit from a touch more oxidation so well made & well suited fro aging as inteded. Nice work for sure. Neat.
Tap. Clear amber, tall nitro creamy head. Malty nose. Honey. Perfume. Esters. I also detected some phenols. Full body. Taste: big malts, vinous, fruity. Low to light bitterness.

Bottle from Geers, Gent - BE. Color: clear brown beer with no carbonation and small ivory head. Smell: sweet caramel notes, candied notes and strong alcohol notes. Good complexity. Taste: full body with strong malt and caramel notes. Candied fruits, and well balanced. Sweet and caramel finish with aclohol. Aftertaste: sweet caramel and candied with good bitterness, quiet boozy but really drinkable.

50 cl bottle from Beergeek st Petersburg. 
Pours amber with biiiig head. Sweet fruity aroma with sweet malty caramel taste. Nutty honey taste with some wine notes.

Bottle sample at a tasting at zvsns place. Thanks tomer. Clear copper with off-white head. Sweetish aroma with notes of honey, anice and raisin. Very sweet flavor with notes of honey, raisin, alcoholic, liqueur, bitterish, soapy, toffee and caramel. Full-bodied. Very nice.

Bottle sample at a tasting, thanks tomer. Almost clear amber color. Aroma is sweet, malty, honey, cookies and floral. Sweet, caramel, molasses, honey, biscuit and fruity flavors. Rather full bodied, smooth and warming. Very good.

Shared at a tasting, almost no head, clear and quite deep red color,aroma of biscuit, sweets and honey, flavor of brown bread, honey, nuts and caramel, light bitterness. Balanced and really nice, classic english.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, Nr Gent, Belgie, consumed at Isobels, Eardisley, Herefordshire Thursday 22nd December 2016   Woah.....this is one sweet beast, crikey. A pretty tasty beer, its very potent, very thick in the mouth, really quite hoppy, but the sweetness is quite hard to cope with. This is one that I wish I could have shared with others. Ok.  A6 A3 T6 P3 Ov12 3.0

Joli orange foncé. Mousse dense ne tombe pas, un exploit pour une bière aussi forte.

Au nez, ça sent lalcool bien évidemment et le grain, un peu malté. 

Dégustation 0.1 l à le Braufest Berlin 2016, 

Miel acacia, grain avec force.

500ml regular bottle from Bochka in Moscow. Pours amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is caramel, malt, marmalade, alcohol. Taste is very alcoholic, bitter hops, marmalade. The booziness made it undrinkable, perhaps this was a bad bottle, because everything else I have tried from this brewer has been excellent at best and drinkable at worst.

Tasted both batches, last one in Kraftwerk Bar in Moscow(Victory Arts prewpub) 
Dark golden color, thin head. Intensive sweet belgian-like phenolic and malty aroma. Taste is really close to heavy belgian sweet ales but too sweet and this combination isnt working for me cause this yeast and this malty profile making this beer bit unpleasant. +0,2 for a rare style

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks Stas & Max. Hazy amber. Aroma of malt, caramel, toffee, stale hops, some smoke, alcohol. Sweet flavor with malt, caramel, toffee, alcohol, a bit of fruitiness, a smoky note, a herbal note, and bitter stale hops. Medium-bodied, rounded. OK, a bit too alcoholic.

0.44l bottle from face off in moscow, as "queen mary 2015". pours a hazy amber with a steady white head. aroma of caramel, dried fruits. massive flavour of malts, grassy hops, dried figs, very bitter and astringent.
Bottle. Amber color. Aroma: wine, dried fruit, raisins, dried apples, sweet and pleasant. Taste: alcoholized, sweet nectar, very wine, raisins, fruit, hop bitterness, a bit unbalanced.
"Это трудная вода" (с) Жесткое, ярко выражен& спиртов& послевк& пьётся тяжелов& не смотря на довольн& богатый букет фруктов& вкусов.

Bottle @ Leuven Innovation Beer Festival 2016 // Deep amber with a very slight haze and an off-whitehead with decent retention. Huge malty and caramel aroma, as well as some dried apricot and and a touch of alcohol (though, nothing objectionable).

16/V/16 - bottle @ Leuven Innovation - BB: n/a (2016-546) Thanks to the Belgian RB crew for sharing todays beers!
Clear amber beer, small creamy off-white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: sweet, caramel, sugary, bit malty, grains, some alcohol, cookie dough. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: very sweet start, caramel, bit floral, soapy, some almonds. Aftertaste: little bitter, fruity touch, lots of ripe banana, sugary, alcohol, bit malty.
PINT tasting. Clear red copper, small off-white foam ring remaining. Sweet aroma, light sour notes. Sweet in taste, floral/fruits tones. Complex in aftertaste, OK but bit too sweet. (Arnhem 201605)
@ LIBF 2016. Hazy amber colour. Caramel, biscuits, bitter hops, Light sweet (brown sugar), bitter finish. Ok.
Clear copper colour. Aroma of toast and marmalade. Flavour is bready. Sticky, syrupy and malty. Some orange peel bitterness in there too.

At LIBF. Now here is an interesting idea: the English city of Burton became famous for its brewing water which was deemed ideal for 19th-century India pale ale, but it already had this tradition of malty Burton ales long before that, and this style too, basically a local variant of English strong ale, was very popular in England for a long time - until it became all but extinct. Victory Art now has this resurrection of the style - Russia probably being the last country Id associate with a historical style this traditionally British. Anyway: medium sized, pale greyish beige head, clear and beautiful coppery bronze robe. Aroma of toffee, honey, fig, caramel candy, gingerbread, rusty iron, apple peel. Sweet and fairly clean dried fruit sweetness, very caramelly and smooth malt body, bit resinous even, gaining a very softly bittering toasted edge in the end as well as a dash of soft herbal and vaguely floral hops and warming, brandy-like alcohol; caramelly and even somewhat brown sugar-like sweetness gets the last word. Rremarkable how these guys have produced an old fashioned, thoroughly malty English style strong ale without any authentic examples to refer to. Nice!

Bottle @ LIBF16. Shared with the RB Belgian team.
Laissons aux russes le plaisir de remettre au gout du jour lancien style de DBA, celui-ci plus atypique avec ces 11% et donc moins en vue que les versions plus légères.
Couleur orange, col léger blanc voire blanc-cassé.
Arôme ay nez assez plaisant, finement houblonné avec des traces anglaises versant vers le noble type EKG et Fuggles.
Palais offer un profil consequent au niveau des malts avec une touche de toffee et presque de léger biscuité. Alcool est bien là avec une dose de douceur de sucre résiduel.

Sweet malts, caramel, simple, Belgian. Surpringly its strong, concentrated, little fermenting fruit sourness, alcohol. Odd start, huge taste, very enjoyable on small quantities. Nothing Burton Ale stout it though, I reckon. (At Libf 2016)

Queen Mary Old Burton ale 2016 No head to speak of; clear orange beer. Caramel, green herbs/weeds, coming up rather strong; bit of orangepeel. Strong caramel, lightly roasted malt flavour. Rather unidimensional. Sticky MF, well-bodied, potent alcohol. Rather typically unidimensional, if not bad. Not really convincingly British, I must add.
Очень необычн& пиво. Одновре& соленое, сладкое и горькое. В аромате немного чувству& алкогол& Пиво очень крепкое и прекрас& согрева& С выдержк& станови& мягче и приятне&
Сладкий крепкий эль, при этом некая "солёно в послевк& рекомен& тем, кому сложно пить пиво с экстрем& горечью

SWING-TOP 50 CL from eluosiren. Deep amber with a very slight haze and an off-whitehead with decent retention. Huge malty and caramel aroma, as well as some dried apricot and and a touch of alcohol (though, nothing objectionable). The taste is also massively sweet, but not sticky or cloying at all. Has some dried fruit, alcohol and hops too. A well done brew.

Aroma: intense caramel, bread, Earl Grey tea. Appearance: hazy brown, medium, creamy, off-white head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: sweets continue, very heavy caramel, bread malts, alcohol. Overall: fantastic Burton Ale, nice sweets and complexity. Bottle at LavkaLavka, Moscow.

Невероя& аромат и вкус.
Прl высоком содержа& алкогол& приятно питок, сбаланс& плотнос& сладост& и неповто& запах алычи.

the aroma is malty with hints of toffee, caramel, garden fruits and vanilla... the taste is rough, malty and fruity with some shades of wine, toffee, lollipop and spices... sweet, bitter and dry aftertaste...

Love the idea of the beer and the legend :)
As for the taste its not bad.
On tap. Unusually, melon flavor, taste sweet but not cloying, plum wine reminded. Is drunk heavily, even 0.3. In warm alcohol sticks. Interesting ale.
